TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit KeyboardNavigation extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides logical and directional navigation between focusable objects.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The KeyboardNavigation class is responsible for implementing default keyboard focus navigation when one of the navigation keys is pressed. The navigation keys are: Tab, Shift+Tab, Ctrl+Tab, Ctrl+Shift+Tab, UpArrow, DownArrow, LeftArrow, and RightArrow keys.
An example of logical navigation is using the tab key to move focus.
An example of directional navigation is using the arrow keys to move focus.
## Examples The following example creates a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Menu> with a number of <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem> objects. The <xref:System.Windows.Input.KeyboardNavigation.TabNavigation%2A> attached property is set to <xref:System.Windows.Input.KeyboardNavigationMode> on the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Menu>. This means that when focus is changed using the tab key within the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Menu>, focus will move from each element and when the last element is reached focus will return to the first element.
[!code-xml[MarkupSnippets#MarkupKeyboardNavigationTabNavigationXAML](~/add/codesnippet/xaml/MarkupSnippets/Window1.xaml#markupkeyboardnavigationtabnavigationxaml)]
[!code-vb[MarkupSnippets#MarkupKeyboardNavigationTabNavigationCODE](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/markupsnippets/window1.xaml.vb#markupkeyboardnavigationtabnavigationcode)] [!code-cs[MarkupSnippets#MarkupKeyboardNavigationTabNavigationCODE](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/MarkupSnippets/Window1.xaml.cs#markupkeyboardnavigationtabnavigationcode)]
